Dear Sheffield City Council,
In the CCTV code of practice it states;
The Council will ensure that all Operatives are trained to a proficient level and are licensed by the Security Industry Authority before they are allowed to take up an operational position in the Control Room. Training will include:
• Use of equipment
• Observation techniques
• City Council procedures and record keeping
• Report procedures and action on incidents
• Evidence handling
• Actions in the event of an emergency
• Legislation and crime prevention
• Operational exercises
• Refresher Training
Please can I see all the documents and training materials that are being used to ensure that all Operatives are trained to a proficient level.
https://www.sheffield.gov.uk/in-your-are...
Yours faithfully,
Mr M. McCullagh

Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 1483
Dear M. McCullagh
Thank you for your recent request for information relating to CCTV
training material which we received on 12/02/2015.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request, and will be
dealt with under the Freedom of Information Act.  The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act states that we must respond to you within
20 working days, therefore, you should expect to hear a response from us
by 12/03/2015.
In the meantime, if you have any queries please contact me on 0114
2734567.
Thank you.
Yours sincerely,
FOI Support Team
Moorfoot Level 8 West Wing
Sheffield S1 4PL
Tel : 0114 20 53478

Dear M. McCullagh
Re: Freedom of Information Request – Reference FOI / 1483
Thank you for your recent request for information regarding CCTV training
material, which we received on 12/02/2015.
Please find below, Sheffield City Council’s response to your request:
Notice under Section 17(1) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 –
REFUSAL OF REQUESTS FOR INFORMATION
This request for information is exempt from disclosure under Section 14 of
the Freedom of Information Act 2000 as it is deemed to be vexatious.
Please note that a formal refusal notice has been sent to your home
address as the release of notice may release private information into the
public domain. By its very nature a Section 14 notice is personal in
nature based on the request history and contact of the requestor with the
public authority
I hope the information we have provided is of help to your enquiries.  If
you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed.  You can ask for an
internal review by either writing to the above address or by emailing
[1][Sheffield City Council request email].
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioners Office. The Information
Commissioner can be contacted at: The Information Commissioner's Office,
Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire SK9 5AF, telephone 0303 123
113, or for further details see their website [2]www.ico.gov.uk
Kind Regards,
FOI Support Team
Moorfoot Level 8 West Wing
Sheffield S1 4PL
Tel : 0114 20 53478
E-mail : [3]FOI @sheffield.gov.uk
